name: Byron Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed two nights in a single at Hotel Byron in late May 2009.
reviews.title: If you want a place to sleep...

reviews.text: Good points -- good bed, in-room bath (toilet, sink, shower), AC, a small lift (good not to have to lug your bags up the stairs), 24-hour reception desk with people knowledgeable about the area (steering me to the good Indian restaurant 3 blocks away, not two mediocre ones that were closer), location (two Tube stations, Bayswater and Queensway, on different lines within two blocks, lots of restaurants/stores within two blocks, fairly quiet street near Hyde Park), TV, wi-fi Internet access...
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in quiet area

reviews.text: Bad points -- matchbox-sized single room (not big enough for a luggage rack), the first night the shower door fell off into my hands as I was taking a shower (but they did manage to fix it), and London lodging is just plain expensive, including this one (but the price was similar to two other places I looked at that had no AC and no lift).
reviews.title: Would definitely stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unknowns -- I did not try the breakfast. I did not get to see a double room.
reviews.title: Budget Hotel Done Right

reviews.text: Conclusion -- stay here if you want a place to sleep but not luxuriate.
reviews.title: Ok for a budget trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in London for a few days. The location of the Byron Hotel is convenient, near two tube stations that sit on different lines. The hotel was clean and tidy, generally well decorated and the staff always pleasant. The breakfast room, being smaller than the amount of guests the hotel can accommodate, works on a rota basis where guests book a 'sitting' the following morning. Works in principle but as you'd expect not everyone turns up at the allocated time, sometimes requiring those who did book in having a brief wait. We booked direct via their website. Our own room, on the top floor, appeared to be built into the attic and was much smaller than we expected, not having much room to swing the proverbial cat. The room had a small window overlooking the rear courtyard, and had the standard facilities you'd expect of a 3star. It appears, from other contributors and their pictures, that there are much better rooms available in the same building. There is a hotel lift which does the job a lift should, although it is 'cosy' with four occupants. To summarise, we would stay again as the hotel is nice enough backed up by pleasant staff but only if the room provided was larger.
reviews.title: Clean and tidy with pleasant staff, our own room was rather small though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally situated just a short walk from Queensway/Bayswater tubes. Plenty of restaurants in locality and good access to shopping and tourist sites. V Close to Hyde Park too.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Double room was small, but well presented with modern furnishings. V clean.
reviews.title: I was very pleased with this hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was offered at £7.95 which seemed reasonable but we didn't have time to enjoy it this time. Hotel also states that it has a bar, but again didn't try. Reception were welcoming and efficient.
reviews.title: very nice hotel, ideally located to visit London for a week-end

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only down side was the loud hum from the electrical circuit board in the room. The lights and power are activated by a slot in card. We solved the problem by removing the card - and had a good nights sleep!
reviews.title: Very nice, clean, quiet hotel near Hyde Park

reviews.text: Would definately recommend this hotel. Yes the rooms are fairly small but you are in the centre of London - that's how it is! If you are expecting bigger you are looking at the wrong class of hotel and price range!
reviews.title: Good clean hotel and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a room for around £100 per night including continental breakfast which is quite good for London at peak season (wouldn't be as happy if I'd paid the full price of £150-180 though!). As it had recently been renovated the rooms were nicely decorated and generally clean except for what looked like a blood stain on my white sheets and a very dusty skirting board.
reviews.title: Nice for the price!

reviews.text: Staff were helpful and common areas were clean and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Not the best hotel, but clean and very central

reviews.text: Good location about a 5 minute walk to Queensway and Bayswayer tube stations and close to hyde park (afternoon tea at Kensington palace is recommended!).
reviews.title: Avoid! No A/C, Run-down, tiny rooms,very rude staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One bit of advice is to ask for a room at the back of the hotel as we were at the front and it was quite noisy.
reviews.title: Good value. Friendly

reviews.text: I am sure that this is a wonderful hotel to stay in -- unless you are put in a basement room. Reading the other reviews confirms this in my mind. We arrived late on a red eye flight, tubed over to our hotel, checked in easily, and were sent downstairs. Our room was huge for a London hotel room, but the shower leaked and there was a very strong smell of mustiness that ruined it for us.
reviews.title: Beware the basement rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was fine, breakfast was solid, the room was ok and a good price performer -- except for that smell! I would never want to stay in their basement rooms again; I might go back if I was guaranteed not to be put in them.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, very clean.
The Byron Hotel feels like coming home
reviews.text: This hotel was very nice. The rooms looked newly refurbished. It was very clean. We love the location near Hyde Park. Paddington station is about a 15 min. walk and it is close to the Queensway Tube station. Some might want something closer to more sights though. The room was very small, but this is typical for London. It is probably the nicest hotel we have stayed at in London.
Once again we had a great time at the Byron Hotel! Thank you for all - it is such a lovely and helpfully staff. It is allways a pleasure to come to the Byron - feels like coming home.
reviews.title: Fantastic, well equipped friendly hotel

reviews.text: Thanks for a great time in London
reviews.title: Country hotel in the middle of London!

description: The Byron is located in the very convenient and cosmopolitan area of Hyde Park and Bayswater. This makes it ideally situated for your visit to London, be it business or pleasure. With good access to all public transport facilities, The Byron is a perfect base from which to explore London. Up to 123 different locations in London are put within easy reach by the 2 metro stations near the hotel. Originally two Victorian houses, and recently refurbished, The Byron has been professionally designed to provide modern standards of comfort in traditional surroundings whilst maintaining a country house atmosphere. Our professionally trained staff will ensure that your stay with us will be a complete and memorable experience.
